reviews.review:
Gameplay: A great series of action packed adventure that allows you to play in any style you like. If you're a melee fighter, you can equipt yourself with the proper items and you're a moster in close range. The only down side is that you can only carry 2 guns at the same time, which gets you into an uncomfortable situations at times, such as facing 4 snipers with a shotgun and a pistol. It sucks, but you'll love it.

Story: With a great narrative by Troy Baker, the voice of Booker DeWitt, the story unfolds itself with many twists and turns that you will not expect. The theme of religious beliefs and human nature is smoothly told with this amazing story. The characters are solid. They don't go againts their beliefs and do random s***.

Visuals: You don't need a lot of detail on this as you have seen the magic on the trailer. The city looks amazing as it should. How can you possible make floating cities look bad?

Overall, it is the best RPG/First person shooter i've played since Half Life 1.

Love++  I have said that the original Bioshock was my favorite game of all time.  I've been playing Infinite for a few hours now and well... it might dethrone the mighty Bioshock 1.

ADDED: As I stated in the my comment below, I finished the game.  Like an addict, I've now purchased the Season Pass and will soon embark on that bit of story.  As I think about it, I'm still in love with this game.  Infinite is definitely my favorite (I've played all three) in the series that has easily become my favorite games.

The writing in this game is purely amazing... better than most movies/tv series.
BEST GAME NA!

I do not often leave a comment about a game, but this game will be an deserving exception.  The gameplay throughout the game is fun and I enjoyed the game despite the fairly rigid plot walking me along.  However, the details, the story, the visuals, and Elizabeth make this game the best game I have ever played.  Without a doubt, this was the most impactful ending to a game I have ever played.  I enjoyed every last second and by the time the credits were rolling I had been playing WAY too long without a break.  If I never play this game again it will remain in my memory as among the fondest story I ever experienced.  I am sure in the coming days I will have some questions I wish were answered, but I do not care.  Buy it if you like stories, buy it if you like strong women, buy it if you like attention to details in games, but mostly just buy it.
Foda *-*
The greatest game I have ever played...

GOTYOAY
(Game Of The Year Of All Years)

Well, not really. But it was pretty good.
This takes the cake for my current favorite game of all time.
If your looking for some fun try this game!!!!!!!!!!!!11

Just bought this game during the Autumn sale last week as it was too good a deal to resist.

Now, just finished playthrough and I was immersed in the story from beginning to end. Exploring EVERYWHERE gave real depth  to the world with the aid of voxaphones, conversations and general background. Don't just blitz through the game if you want full storyline value as I imagine you will quickly become confused by what is happening. Note: This isn't a completely 'open' world, so you won't get too sidetracked going through all the doors on your journey forward. I found myself making sure I went everywhere the game was NOT trying to get me to go before I would move forward.

The graphics were well polished for the most part - I had them set on high which caused a bit of stuttering upon entering some new areas, but overall very smooth despite my system being on the old side.

The actual gameplay which was interspersed with the story was relatively generic FPS. Set the difficulty higher for a greater challenge and use of strategy, or lower if you want to have fun messing around with vigor/combat combos. Doesn't matter as the storyline was really the main focus for me in this game.

A note on autosaving: I have seen a few comments complaining about the lack of save feature in this game. I get what the game is going for here though: They want you to face the consequences of death (loss of a bit of money and small health regen of enemies) rather than have you quicksave right before facing a harder battle. It's a bit annoying for real world timing trying to figure out if you will be able to quit the game in the next 5 minutes or not, but as long as you pay attention to when it is saving (rotating circle in the corner) or when it tells you the time your last quicksave was before you quit, there shouldn't be any nasty surprises when you log in again to find you lost 20 minutes of progress.

Lots of fun - will definitely have to play again in 1999 mode once I've worked my way through other games =/.
Die Geschichte lässt einen durchdrehen !

I'm afraid my vocabulary is not broad enought to recommend this game hard enough, the first thing you notice stepping into the sky city of columbia is the grahpics, sweet jesus the graphics. Now I have a fairly powerful computer so I had the settings on high so be aware that you will probbaly need a pretty beefy system to run it on high settings. The gameplay is very smooth and enjoyable, the combat works well with the selection of guns you are given, the skyhook is one of the best features in a modern game in terms of combat. All the vigors are worth using and salts are hard enough to find (untill elizabeth is throwing them at you every 5 seconds) in the beginning of the game at least so as to add an element of difficulty to using the vigors. The storyline is the best of 2013 hands down, plenty of plot development and twists to keep your mind constently at work trying to keep up with the plot.
I say again I cannot recommend this game hard enough.

Há um tempo não jogava algo que me prendesse tanto a atenção na história como em Bioshock Infinite. Gráficos maravilhosos, ambientes muito bem trabalhados. O gameplay não me mostrou muitas novidades em relação ao Bioshock original, eu diria até que é um jogo "fácil" depois que vc faz upgrade nas armas, e rápido. A personagem feminina é demais. Senti uma AI fraca, só mesmo destacando os "chefões-robôs", e uma maior dificuldade no embate final. O destaque está na história, que tem um quê de "Fringe", fazendo o jogador se sentir totalmente imerso nas descobertas. É um jogo maravilhoso, com um final épico e muito bem construído. 9.5/10

I bought this when it came out for 360 because I was a huge BioShock fan. Mistake.

This game is NOT bad, it is a downright overhyped dissapointment. It looks great and works generally fine, there is no amazing soundtrack (not that big a deal), but where it falls short is the content.

GAMEPLAY: Gameplay is horribly repetitive. The false sense of open space is actually more confining than the actual confined space found in the first two games. Gameplay consists of pathetic "vigors" that have no taste and all have trap versions. The guns are underpowered generally, don't seem cool, and the removal of the weapon wheel is a bust as ammo is no longer conserved. The sky-hook is insanely broken. What could have been the selling point of the game (and kinda was) was boring, repetitive, and screwed up your objective beacon. The Elizabeth tears were alright but anoyying and the constant backtracking was a strain.

ENVIRONMENT: The environment is dirt. At first, the environment is cool; walking around a steampunk 1900s racist city and all, seeing the magical tech at work. As soon as the tears start happening and you start running around, you realize how boring it all is. The game doesn't feel like a fight for survival and freedom on a floating city - it feels like MMO quests in first-person on a bunch of blimps. The best level when a "scare"-factor is actually involved comes too few and too late.

STORY: The story is linear and bland. The main story is fairly guessable and not fleshed out. Voxophones, which are like the audiorecorders of old Bioshock, offer little and are too hard to get too. The DLC storylines are too blatant in their fit to the paradoxy of Infinite, getting those weak fools who enjoy this game to drool over the worst dialogue ever.

CONCLUSION: A total buchery of one of the best games I've ever played. Removes all the good elements of bioshock 1 & 2, has a ridiculous story, awful environment, and the vigors (the point of bioshock) are extremely underplayed and have no story implementation. What was once a survival horror game is now the posterchild of absurd MetaCritic scores.

A good game, not what it should have been. Kind of like a Halo 4 but even more dissapointing. 75/100

After the great Bioshock (one of my most favourite games of all times) and a quite mediocre Bioshock 2 I was curious if Bioshock Infinite would be so amazing as the previews mentioned. Now I am glad I just bought it on Steam Autumn Sale for less than 10 €...

Bioshock 3 is a shooter, quite different from the previous titles. By the setting in a town, floating in the sky, it lost all of it's dark and terrifying atmosphere which made Bioshock once so great.

So let's start by the good things:
Bioshock 3 isn't bad at all. 

Technical:
Graphically fitting you walk through a shiny world, see scyscrapers and go by the sky-line railsystem from platform to the other. I played the game with highest graphics, but it is only mediocre. Sound is ok, but not overwhelming.

Fighting:
Weapons are varying and for every taste you get some weapons. In my case the huntsman carbine and the pig flak volley gun... *cough*
Enemies act not too stupid. Only few enemy types.
The vigors, Jedi-like forces that support in quite funny ways, are quite different and function quite good. 

Story:
The story seems easy at the start, but gets very twisted later. You might need more than playthrough to get everything of the story. Some few hidden places you can find while playing, giving you special equipment like hats and stuff.


Now the bad things:
I am totally disappointed. Forget the trailers...

Technical:
Graphically it is ok, but that's it. Nothing special.
Another nuisance is the "invisible wall". In games from the 1990's an invisible wall as level-border can be accepted. In games from 2012/2013 NOT. Dear programmers, do me a favour: stop creating the illusion I could walk somewhere when I CAN'T!

Fighting:
Fights are mostly too chaotic. And the enemies can see through walls (in some cases also SHOOT through walls...).
A lot of vigors, the half of it would have been already enough. I just used shock jockey, possession (only at the last airship level) and devil's kiss (which traps didn't work sometimes....). The rest is a nice idea. I missed a freezing power. Oh wait... THAT you get in a dlc. Amazing..............................

Story:
I enjoyed the story, it was pushing you forward, wanting to know what happens next. I really didn't expect the turns, ups and downs of the story. But the end: At first I was irritated, then thought of it all. Remebered the game.... and uninstalled. Seriously? After all these hours? Dear writers, I love good written stories. You did a pretty good job there, but this ending is the most stupid I have ever seen in a game. Ok, maybe not THE worst, but it is very close to that rank.

Things that COULD have made Bioshock Infinite better:
There could have been so many possibilities to play with the fear of heights of the players, but this chance was missed.
I have a fear of heights, but wasn't one time afraid of falling down somewhere.
Bugs like waving textures (really annoying in ingame-cutscenes), missing textures or missing sounds should be fixed before selling a game.
Only three persons are consistant in this game, the player, Elizabeth, and the prophet. The other persons stay quite faceless.
The enemies act ok, but they are all exchangable.

If I hadn't bought the game on a Steam Sale, I would be now quite vexed.
The last hour of this game is fantastic, so touching.
Ken Levine dice tutto. Meno bello del primo forse ma comunque da avere per gli appasionati della saga.
Wow.
Galattico!
Grab it in the next sale if you can - probably one of my top 10 games ever for the combination of story, action, world design & art direction.

Поначалу скептически отнесся к упрощенной системе развития персонажа и достаточно примитивной боевке с тупыми противниками, перекочевавшими прямиком из первой игры. Но все это с лихвой окупается великолепным сюжетом и, в особенности, непредсказуемой концовкой проливающей свет также и на ранние части франшизы.
Тем не менее за отсутствие нормальной карты уровня, как в предыдущих частях, разработчикам хочется выразить пару ласковых. Игра, как и ранее, подталкивает к внимательному исследованию уровней на предмет различных секретов, но без карты это делать крайне уморительно, постоянно нужно держать все закоулки в голове.
С учетом всех мелочей лично моя оценка игре - 8.5/10. Безусловный мастхев для всех, кто любит безумно красивые игры и сюжет со множеством неожиданных поворотов.
E una bestia
Die Grafik ist BioShock, das Spiel ist BioShock, die Story ist BioShock - es ist eine kurzweilige & tolle Unterhaltung!
builds on the previous games to become one of the best games ever with a twisty turny narrative sorely needed in the rest of the industry. BUY IT NOW!

I only recently plowed through 1 and 2, and I mean in 2103. (I know)  I held off buying this game, and at 9.99 it was a no brainer.  I loved this game, all the little touches, the twists, attention to detail, the list goes on and on. Nutshell: it's like getting a blow job each time you play.
If you like good games then you should probably buy Bioshock Infinite. Gameplay 10 Story 11

Bioshock infinite, while not like the previous installments of Bioshock, is better than the first. This game is a perfect example of why it is not a bad thing to delay the release date. With great action, great story, great mechanics, awesome graphics, and extrodinary characters this game is a must play! It will entice Bioshock fans, first person shooter fans, and in depth narritive enthusiasts. This game will have you on the edge of your seat until the end credits start rolling!

This game brings the next generation of amazing graphics, you will love the world of bioshock infinite, it has a smooth feel to the game, the action into it is great fun and the ambience of the game fits perfect. It is a major step-up from Bioshock 1-2. I definatly recomend this game it has to be one of my favourites and deserves the Game Of The Year award.
This game is worth every penny. It has a really good story and derserves the couple hours of your gaming time.

Bioshock Infinite è un capolavoro, uno di quei giochi che una volta giocati, ti rimangono impressi in mente.  Graficamente "datato", offre il meglio di se nella storia e nel gameplay. Raramente si vedono giochi che coinvolgono il giocatore in questo modo. 

La trama: E' il 1912, sei un detective (Booker DeWitt) pieno di debiti e un giorno ti si presenta un occasione per saldarli. "Portaci la ragazza e annulla il debito!". Ciò che dobbiamo fare è prendere una ragazza (Elizabeth) imprigionata nella città volante di Columbia. Tutto qui. Non vi sto a fare spoiler o a dire cosa può o non può accadere, giocatelo.

Il gameplay invece è quello di un classico FPS, con una variabile: i Vigor. I Vigor non sono altro che dei "poteri" che aiutano il giocatore in diverse situazioni, tipo quello di rendere i nemici amici per un periodo limitato di tempo. 

Il gioco dura circa 8-9 ore, senza contare fasi esplorative ("esplorative"... il gioco è molto lineare), la ricerca dei collezionabili, ecc..

Il gioco lo consiglio, pagato 7.49€ durante i saldi, e ne sono pienamente soddisfatto.
Эту игру Вы точно никогда не забудете!!!Обязательно к прохождению, причем со всеми дополнениями!!!
YIIIAAOOOZA'}

Что такое BioShock Infinite? Это - Игра Года, Лучшая История, Лучшая Графика и т. д. Можно еще долго перечислять награды которые эта игра получит! Меня игра настолько увлекла, что после первого прохождения, я сразу начал второе! Говорю всем - это шедевр! Такого сюжета еще ни где не было, хотя The Last of Us тоже ничего! 
Вообщем покупайте все - это самая лучшая игра!

My all time favorite game! Has stunning visuals, captivating dialog and a perfect mix of weapon use and vigors which togteher makes for the best shooter experience I've ever had the pleasure of playing. 10/10

Great game overall, ending was kind of lack luster though...hopefully the new dlc "Return to Rapture" makes up for the ending. Again great game overall, just don't expect a great ending.

The only aspect of the game that surpasses the excellent FP shooting, the constant action that is only interrupted by fantastic scenery and exploration, and the true to Bioshock gameplay is the incredible story that unfolds through playing. The ending literally had my jaw dropping. Perhaps the best game I've ever played. Do not miss out on this.
